name: Nimbu Pani
history: Nimbu Pani, commonly known as Indian lemonade, is a traditional Indian beverage. It's a staple in Indian households, especially during the hot summer months, and is known for its refreshing and hydrating properties.
description: Nimbu Pani is a simple yet revitalizing drink made from freshly squeezed lemon juice, water, sugar, and a pinch of salt. It's often flavored with mint, cumin, and other spices, and served chilled to beat the heat.

instructions.title: Mix Ingredients
instructions.description: Squeeze the lemons into a mixing glass or jug. Add sugar, salt, and cold water. Stir well until the sugar is completely dissolved.

instructions.title: Add Optional Ingredients
instructions.description: For additional flavor, add mint leaves and roasted cumin powder. Mix well.

instructions.title: Serve Chilled
instructions.description: Add ice cubes to the glasses. Pour Nimbu Pani over the ice. Serve chilled for a refreshing experience.

tips: Adjust the sweetness and tartness according to your preference.
Chill the water in advance for an instantly cold drink.
variations: Add a splash of soda water for a fizzy twist.
Experiment with different citrus fruits like oranges or limes for variation.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed immediately. Can be refrigerated for a few hours.
storage.instructions: Store in the refrigerator and stir well before serving.

presentationTips: Garnish with lemon slices and mint sprigs for a visually appealing presentation.
Serve in traditional Indian glassware for an authentic experience.
